channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 2026 private equity outlook appears hazy, says PitchBook
item.description: PitchBook data shows private equity exit value surged, even as fundraising struggled.

item.title: Chevrolet is trying to do patriotism without politics in its America250 ad
item.description: Chevrolet’s latest splashy ad has all the hallmarks of a campaign strategically tied to America’s 250th anniversary. There’s the modern interpretation...

item.title: The ‘dumb money’ steps in as traders lose $1 trillion on the realization that AI will eat tech companies first
item.description: The chaos is mostly a tech-stock phenomenon. The equal-weight S&P 500 is actually at a record high.

item.title: What the bedroom can teach the boardroom about healthy, thriving relationships
item.description: After more than two decades as a psychosexual therapist, I have learned to listen carefully for what people are not saying. When vulnerability is clos...

item.title: 1 Bold Decision Helped Make Walmart a Trillion-Dollar Company. Most CEOs Do the Opposite
item.description: Even Warren Buffett thought it might not work.

item.title: Developer Hongkong Land launches a $6.5B Singapore real estate fund, the country’s largest, as part of CEO Michael Smith’s strategic pivot
item.description: The new fund has the Qatar Investment Authority as a key investor, as Hongkong Land focuses on commercial property and slims its residential business.

item.title: This Gen Z woman applied for 1,000 jobs and offered to cut her own pay because she was ‘really broke and struggling.’ She’s not alone
item.description: Taking a pay cut at the beginning of your career can have long-term consequences.

item.title: Less than 10% of employees believe their bosses are demonstrating moral leadership
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: 185 Billion Reasons Google Isn’t Worried AI Will Kill Search
item.description: Google is spending an unthinkable sum on building out its infrastructure as it leverages its advantages.

item.title: Anthropic’s “Dishonest” Ads Clearly Struck a Nerve With Sam Altman. That Was the Point
item.description: The Super Bowl ads highlight what everyone already thinks about advertising in AI.

item.title: The Neuroscience of Why ‘Relaxing’ With Your Phone Actually Makes You More Stressed
item.description: You think staring at your phone helps your mind and body wind down, but science disagrees. Try these analog activities instead.

item.title: Can 2026 finally be the year Black-owned businesses are covered for their accomplishments, not just DEI?
item.description: Over the past two years, a troubling trend has started to take shape in the media; for a large majority of journalists, DEI framing became the default...

item.title: These 5 brands are winning the Super Bowl pregame push
item.description: The Super Bowl is mere days away and chances are you’ve seen most of the ads already. Right? Let’s rewind for a 10-second Super Bowl ad history lesson...

item.title: How to Access Visa’s New $100 Million Small Business Loan Program
item.description: Exclusive: ‘Visa & Main’ brings various SMB-centric offerings under one roof, including a new working capital facility offered via Lendistry.
